We want to foster a vibrant, evolving community that respects individual preferences and adapts to your changing needs. 

Our new guidelines follow 3 principles:
1. Empower user choice
2. Cultivate a welcoming environment
3. Evolve with feedback

We take seriously our responsibility to Bluesky users

record.text: Want a quick way to track the buzz around Taylor Swift’s new album #TS12 or follow the upcoming Premier League season? Independent developers like @graze.social and @blueskyfeedcreator.com make it easy to build your own custom feeds so you can follow exactly what you care about 🧡

A big reason I prefer BlueSky over other social media platforms is its moderation system 🛡️. Although other platforms have moderation tools, BlueSky’s approach is far more effective and reliable. That’s why it remains my favorite 💙
@bsky.app Thank you so much for giving us such a wonderful platform 💙

my bluesky experience in a nutshell. didn’t expect the switch to amount to much, honestly, but now it’s my main app of choice; with genuine, kind people i’m happy to call friends.

value.text: It's crazy how you sign up to a new social media app on a random day, and then several months down the line, you've made new genuine friendships 🥹💕

value.text: PSA on links: On Bluesky, there’s no limit to the number of links you can share, and they will receive the same visibility as your other posts 💙

record.text: One thing that still sometimes freaks me out about Bluesky for ultimately good reasons involving the lack of an omnipresent algorithm is how routinely I discover a big account I had no idea was on here. Nigella Lawson is on Bluesky, posts regularly, has over 100k followers, had no idea.
It's so pleasant to be able to scroll on here and not endure a barrage of targeted ads 😵‍💫

Much thanks to the developers at @bsky.app who implemented the Notifications option. I took the time today to set up notifications for all of the people I follow here that I followed on the other site, many of them as far back as 2009. Love that their posts won't get lost in the timeline!

Much thanks to the developers at @bsky.app who implemented the Notifications option. I took the time today to set up notifications for all of the people I follow here that I followed on the other site, many of them as far back as 2009. Love that their posts won't get lost in the timeline!

record.text: Bluesky doesn't penalize you for using links, tags, using key words like Patreon or commissions, and doesn't have a central algorithm on your following feed, which means all the power rests on you to help your favourite creators be seen!

We’re not books but we went from not having a newspaper to being one of the most subscribed to newspapers in America in less than a year, and our social media conversion numbers are attributable to Bluesky by a good plurality.

value.text: Is there *any* evidence that presence on bsky contributes in any way to book sales? I’ll take anecdotes! Who here has bought a book bc they heard about it on bsky *alone*? Because I’m ready to bounce.

record.text: Because Bluesky is built on a protocol, an outside group can build end-to-end encrypted messaging long before the core Bluesky team likely would have gotten around to it. Very cool ➡️

value.text:
The @germnetwork.com team has been participating in the #e2eemessagingWG to figure out a way to have secure private group messaging that is compatible with ATProto.

They've shipped a proof of concept of using your account to do this!

You'll need to get on the waitlist as they slowly add people.

external.description: Germ DM is now a Bluesky messenger.
external.title: Germ DM x ATProto is Now in Beta

value.text: It’s here! Germ DM is now an #ATProto messenger. Read our full announcement now.
